caption.p: Respiratory syncytial virus infection in an immunosuppressed infant following heart transplant. ( a) In contrast to healthy children, immunocompromised patients with RSV infection show relative paucity of lymphocytic infiltrates and more prominent syncytial-type multinucleate giant cells in tissue sections. Some of the syncytial giant cells are necrotic, and others show characteristic eosinophilic globular cytoplasmic viral inclusions ( arrows). The abundance of intra-alveolar granular necrotic debris may mimic alveolar proteinosis (H&E, 200×). ( b) Immunohistochemistry for RSV antigen is helpful in confirming the diagnosis, if not already identified by culture or molecular methods (RSV immunohistochemistry, 100×)
